intro: Aspilia sahariensis, commonly known as the Saharan torchflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange inflorescence. The plant has a compact, shrub-like growth habit with hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low precipitation. Aspilia sahariensis plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and provides nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
